info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 4:15AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...AREAS OF BLACK ICE CAUSING TREACHEROUS ROAD CONDITIONS THIS MORNING... A winter storm affected much of the region with ice, snow, and sleet Saturday night and Sunday. Roads became wet and slushy in many areas as temperatures warmed Sunday afternoon, but many of those roads are likely to become icy again this morning. Slippery, treacherous road conditions will likely persist through this morning. Although some melting is expected today as temperatures warm above freezing under abundant sunshine, some secondary or shaded roads may remain treacherous through the day. Transportation agencies are advising the public to stay off roads this morning unless absolutely necessary. Any motorists that do venture out are urged to use extreme caution. If a road looks wet, it likely is covered in a thin sheet of ice.
